articles.title: Donald Trump's Gift to AI Companies
articles.author: Matteo Wong
articles.summary: Donald Trump unveiled his administration's 'AI Action Plan' today. The document details the president's 'vision of global AI dominance' and offers a road map for America to achieve it. The action plan has three major 'pillars': enhancing AI innovation, developing more AI infrastructure and promoting American AI.

articles.title: Trump Rejects Idea of Paying Copyright Holders for AI Training: ‘It Just Doesn't Work That Way'
articles.author: Gene Maddaus
articles.summary: President Trump spoke at an AI Summit in Washington, D.C. about the issue of paying copyright holders whose works are used for AI training. He said it is impractical and would put the U.S. at a disadvantage to China. AI companies have argued in court that AI training on copyrighted data is protected fair use.

articles.title: Not just used for cheating:  Educators discuss strategic ways to integrate AI into classrooms
articles.author: Annalisa Burgos
articles.summary: AI is changing how kids learn and teachers need to adapt to tap into its potential. Mid-Pacific Institute's second annual AI EdFuture Summit is taking place this week. Education leads all industries in AI adoption, with 86% of organizations reporting its use. Critics worry students will become dependent on AI and lose critical thinking skills. Adopters say AI enhances student learning and gives them a competitive edge in a world where AI will be everywhere.

articles.title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai shrugs off Silicon Valley's raging AI talent wars
articles.author: Charles Rollet
articles.summary: Sundar Pichai addressed the latest wave of AI talent wars during Google's second-quarter earnings call on Wednesday. He said Google's core retention and new talent retention metrics are healthy. AI startups like OpenAI and Anthropic are poaching top AI researchers from Google's DeepMind division.

articles.title: White House plan signals 'open-weight first' era—and enterprises need new guardrails
articles.summary: The U.S. President Donald Trump signed the AI Action Plan. It is not a blueprint for enterprise AI development, but it lays out the administration's priorities and stance on AI development. The most important part of the plan is supporting open-source systems and creating a new testing and evaluation ecosystem.

articles.title: Trump's AI action plan is a ‘Silicon Valley free-for-all': But what does it mean for Canada?
articles.author: Yvonne Lau
articles.summary: On Wednesday, the U.S. President Donald Trump unveiled the country's Artificial Intelligence Action Plan. The plan aims to assert American dominance and leadership in the technology by removing regulatory barriers, fast-tracking data centres, exporting American AI, and developing AI that is 'free from ideological bias.' Critics say the plan is a 'billion-dollar giveaway to Big Tech'

articles.title: Happy Docs Make Happy Patients
articles.author: Joplin Globe
articles.summary: Mercy's strategic use of artificial intelligence (AI) is making patients happier with their care and doctors more satisfied with their work thanks to more meaningful face-to-face time with their patients. The company has received national recognition for physician satisfaction thanks to this technology.

articles.title: Alphabet Boosted by AI, Cloud Demand as Spending Needs Skyrocket
articles.author: Julia Love
articles.summary: Alphabet's parent company said it will spend $85 billion on AI by 2025. The company beat expectations for second-quarter revenue and profit, but its stock initially sank in after-hours trading. Google's cloud-computing unit reported quarterly revenue of $13.6 billion and operating income of $2.83 billion, topping analysts' projections.

articles.title: Trump Plans to Give A.I. Developers a Free Hand
articles.summary: President Trump signed three executive orders on Wednesday to promote the development of artificial intelligence in the United States. He wants to speed up the permitting process for major A.I. infrastructure projects and promote the export of American A.i. products around the world. He also wants to make it easier for companies to build infrastructure to power the technology. The tech giants are in a fierce competition to produce generative AI products and persuade consumers to use them.

articles.title: Are College Professors Still Relevant In The Age Of AI?
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: New Artificial Intelligence tools are being used to cut down on the rising cost of education. It is difficult for instructors to cope with this situation.    - Simon Tisdall, author of a book on the subject, asks what are instructors to do?

articles.title: Trump signs 3 executive orders to advance AI
articles.author: Alexandra Kelley
articles.summary: President Donald Trump signed three new executive orders on Wednesday evening. They aim to streamline federal permitting for energy infrastructure and promote the U.S.-made AI tech stack abroad. They also aim to remove biased or 'woke' AI technologies from the government. Trump spoke at the "Winning the AI Race" summit hosted by All‑In Podcast and Hill & Valley Forum.

articles.title: Trump administration plans to give AI developers a free hand
articles.summary: Trump administration wants to speed up the development of AI and make it easier for American companies to build data centers abroad. Conservatives have accused some tech companies of developing AI models with a baked-in liberal bias. On Wednesday, Trump delivered his first major speech on AI and signed executive orders related to the technology.

articles.title: Amazon Confirms Closure of Its Shanghai AI Lab
articles.summary: Amazon is closing an artificial intelligence lab it established in Shanghai seven years ago. It's the latest American company to scale back its China-based research force amid ongoing U.S.-China tensions. The lab opened during the 2018 World Artificial Intelligence Conference (WAIC). It was Amazon's flagship investment in overseas AI research. The team published more than 100 research papers and built from scratch the Deep Graph Library (DGL), an open-source framework for machine learning on graph-structured data. DGL generated nearly $1 billion in revenue for Amazon's e-commerce business.

articles.title: Trump's ‘anti-woke AI' order could reshape how US tech companies train their models
articles.author: Rebecca Bellan
articles.summary: Trump signed an executive order banning 'woke AI' and AI models that aren't 'ideologically neutral' from government contracts. It comes the same day the White House published Trump's 'AI Action Plan' which focuses on building out AI infrastructure, cutting red tape for tech companies, shoring up national security, and competing with China.

articles.title: Trump unveils sweeping new plan for America's 'global dominance' in artificial intelligence
articles.summary: Trump signed three executive orders to deliver on the plan for America's dominance in the artificial intelligence race. The U.S. will do "whatever it takes to lead the world" on AI, Trump says.   .     "The United States will do whatever it takes" to win the AI race.

articles.title: President Trump signs executive orders to loosen AI regulations
articles.author: Christopher Salas
articles.summary: President Trump signed three executive orders on artificial intelligence at the White House. He wants to promote the U.S.-made AI technology across the world and cut back on AI regulations. Critics argue it will hurt innovation and big tech companies. James Steyer, founder and CEO of Common Sense Media, criticizes the approach.

articles.title: President Trump signs executive orders to loosen AI regulations
articles.author: Christopher Salas
articles.summary: President Trump signed three executive orders on artificial intelligence at the White House. The 'AI Action Plan' calls for America to establish "global dominance" in the industry and promotes the U.S.-made AI technology across the world. It also proposes to cut back environmental laws to accelerate construction of data centers and supercomputers.

articles.title: AI will transform tomorrow's systems to provide self-optimising ships under human supervision, says OneLink Performance

articles.summary: The Trump administration on Wednesday unveiled a sweeping federal action plan to supercharge innovation, cut red tape, and outpace strategic rivals like China. The plan is titled "Winning the AI race: America's AI action plan" and is framed as AI as the next great global battleground.

articles.title: UgenticAI Raises $4M to Scale Portfolio of Agentic AI Companies Aimed at Transforming Small Business Operations

articles.summary: UgenticAI, an AI holding company, has raised $4 million in funding to expand its growing portfolio of agentic AI companies. They use AI to autonomously execute complex business functions such as sales, content creation, and customer support. According to Gartner and McKinsey, there are over 450 million small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) worldwide and 76% of them haven't adopted AI tools yet. Ugentic AI's strategy is to change that narrative by acquiring companies with established traction or building new ones from scratch.

articles.title: Teens say they are turning to AI for friendship
articles.author: Jocelyn Gecker
articles.summary: More than 70% of teens have used AI companions and half use them regularly, according to a new study from Common Sense Media. The study polled more than 1,000 teens nationwide in April and May and found that 31% find chatting with AI companions more satisfying than talking with real friends.

articles.title: Teens say they are turning to AI for friendship

The plan has three policy pillars: accelerating innovation, building AI infrastructure, and leading international diplomacy and security. It supports easier permitting for data centers, semiconductor plants and the modernization of the nation's electric grid. It also calls for states with 'burdensome AI regulations' to be penalized by not receiving AI-related federal funding.

The product is an AI-powered solution that allows you to interview every candidate over video without sacrificing quality, structure, or human insight. Humanly has raised $24 million to date and competes against a wide swath of recruiting startups and larger platforms.

articles.summary: A viral image purporting to show Rowan Atkinson, best known for playing Mr. Bean, was generated by AI. Lead Stories fact checked the image and found out it's not authentic. The image has been circulating online since April 2025, but a reverse image search on Google didn't show credible organizations publishing it on their websites.

articles.title: Trump's AI Action Plan removes ‘red tape' for AI developers and data centers, punishes states that act alone • Michigan Advance
articles.author: Paige Gross
articles.summary: The Trump administration released an action plan on Wednesday to promote the development and use of advanced artificial intelligence. The plan takes a hands-off approach to AI safeguards, and invests in getting more American workers to use AI in their daily lives. The action plan outlines three major pillars — accelerate AI innovation, build American AI infrastructure and lead in international AI diplomacy and security. To support the proposed increases in AI use, the plan outlines a streamlined permitting process for data centers.

articles.title: Google's AI push pays off with solid second quarter, but doubts about company's future persist

Google's shift into artificial intelligence helped propel its corporate parent to the growth. A crackdown on Google's internet empire looms in the background. The results were released Wednesday for the April to June period.

articles.summary: Trump proposes to cut back environmental regulations to speed up the construction of AI supercomputers and promote the sale of U.S.-made AI technologies. articles.title: Amazon AI Hiring: Dominance & The Talent War
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Nearly 70% of AI professionals are actively seeking new opportunities. Amazon's AI-related job postings have increased by over 300% in the last two years, outpacing Google and Microsoft combined. Amazon is acquiring AI companies and building out dedicated AI divisions across multiple sectors. The rise of 'AI-first' companies is increasing the shortage of skilled AI professionals. Small businesses and startups struggle to compete with Amazon, Google, and Microsoft.

articles.title: U.S. Education Department encourages schools to use AI in the classroom
articles.author: Molly Gibbs
articles.summary: The U.S. Department of Education is encouraging schools across the country to take advantage of federal funding to expand their use of artificial intelligence. The move comes as some experts have expressed concern the technology could exacerbate inequality and deepen the digital divide. David Goldberg, president of the California Teachers Association, slammed the Trump administration for focusing on artificial intelligence while slashing school funding.

articles.title: AI Is Powering Every Part of Meta's Ad Business, Say Analysts
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: JMP analyst Andrew Boone reiterated a Market Outperform rating on the stock with a $750.00 price target. AI makes Meta's content more engaging, creating more ad impressions, and making its ads more relevant, increasing click-through rates and conversions. AI stocks offer greater upside potential and carry less downside risk.

articles.title: Apple (AAPL) Stock Rated Hold as HSBC Flags AI Letdown and Tariff Risks
articles.author: Ghazal Ahmed
articles.summary: HSBC has a 'Hold' rating on Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) and a $220 price target. The firm has quoted a '5% regulatory discount' and warned that tariff and legal uncertainties may limit near-term upside. Apple's AI efforts for driving hardware upgrades through artificial intelligence have been falling short. Tariffs are also a major concern for the company.

articles.title: AI Deciphers Ancient Latin Inscriptions & History
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Google DeepMind's Aeneas is an AI-powered research assistant for deciphering fragmented ancient inscriptions. It is based on a vast database of nearly 150,000 cataloged Latin inscriptions spanning from modern-day Britain to Iraq. The system takes partial transcriptions and scanned images of inscriptions and predicts missing text based on its extensive database. It provides researchers with a range of hypotheses, saving them countless hours of manual searching.

articles.title: Trump Signs AI Orders, Vows US Will Win Race Over New Technology

The orders include a measure addressing energy and permitting issues for AI infrastructure, a directive to promote AI exports, and one that calls for large language models procured by the government to be neutral and unbiased.

articles.title: AI bots deliver garbage based on Wikipedia
articles.author: Post Editorial Board
articles.summary: According to Axios, ChatGPT, Gemini and Claude are three of the most popular AI bots. They use Wikipedia to train their Large Language Models. Wikipedia is heavily biased to the left. Conservative sources like Fox News, Daily Wire, Daily Caller and The Post are redlined as unreliable.

articles.title: The Chatbot Culture Wars Are Here

The president is expected to sign three additional executive orders on Wednesday to reinforce the plan.
